Questions.Question1: I think that I would like to use [this] %VARIABLE% frequently.

Questions.Question3: I thought [this] %VARIABLE% was easy to use.

Questions.Question4: I think that I would need the support of a technical person to be able to use [this] %VARIABLE%.

Questions.Question5: I found the various functions in [this] %VARIABLE% were well integrated.

Questions.Question6: I thought there was too much inconsistency in [this] %VARIABLE%

Questions.Question7: I would imagine that most people would learn to use [this] %VARIABLE% very quickly.

Questions.Question8: I found [this] %VARIABLE% very cumbersome to use.

Questions.Question10: I needed to learn a lot of things before I could get going with [this] %VARIABLE%.

VariantGeneratorDescription: The original SUS questionnaire by Brooke that was developed in 1986. It is intended to be used with the descriptor "system" and uses the word "cumbersome" in question 8. Despite good internal reliability, consequent research suggested that the word "cumbersome" can lead to comprehension problems with some participants. While the original, this version is not the most commonly used variant of the SUS today.
